name: Tilted Teepees
description:
A deep and narrow slot. Ghosting (toggle & sand trap) or natural anchors.

Approach

Use the long approach for Headless Duck. Please follow the well defined path leading through the hoodoos. Careless footprints have negatively impacted the "crypto-cactus gardens".

Descent

Only one or possibly two rappels. Generally easy and secure downclimbs. Be aware that one is very skinny and if you have to go higher to fit you might get into X territory.

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

I first descended this canyon about twenty years ago. On that trip we found an old webbing anchor showing that the canyon has been visited for a while. A local said they call the formation at the head of the canyon the "Tilted Teepees", so that's the name I've used. We've since been collectively referring to the canyons on the King bench as the Transformer slots since in many of them there is "more than meets the eye".
